intro: Veprecella biformis, commonly known as the two-form velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with three to five lobes and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in moist, disturbed habitats. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Veprecella biformis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world as a garden plant.
